page.title: 03NORTH RONALDSAY'S SHEEP
page.content: Our sheep are very rare,they are native to North Ronaldsay.There are hardly any of them anywhere else in the world. It is said that they resemble goats,they are moorit (brown),black and a touch of grey.And around the size of a large labrador. The lambs are born in May,the ewes have up to four lambs but most of the time when they have three or four lambs one or two are drowned because it is too much for the mother. Their fleece is very soft for spinning by hand which some people do, but it is usually sold.First of all it is given to Hugh Trebb to be weighed then it is put on the boat and goes to a Mr C.Scott who sells it to Scottish,English and Welsh Wool Growers.There it is sorted and put to an auction.
